byline.contributor: James Kanter reported from Brussels, and Mark Scott from Rome. Michael Cieply and Brooks Barnes contributed reporting from Los Angeles.
byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and MARK SCOTT

abstract: European Commission sends antitrust charges to Sky UK, Disney, NBCUniversal, Paramount Pictures, Sony, Fox and Warner Bros regarding unfair blocking of access to films and other video content; Margrethe Vestager, European Union's competition commissioner, says charges stem from fact that European consumers are entitled to watch pay-TV channels regardless of where they live or travel in EU.
lead_paragraph: The bloc, which opened the investigation in January 2014, said the companies prevented consumers from gaining access to content outside Sky UK’s licensed territory of Britain and Ireland.

headline.main: E.U. Opens Antitrust Case Against Major U.S. Studios and Sky UK
headline.print_headline: European Antitrust Case Against U.S. Film Studios and Sky UK

snippet: The bloc, which opened the investigation in January 2014, said the companies prevented consumers from gaining access to content outside Sky UK’s licensed territory of Britain and Ireland.
